channel.title: Portforwarding problems please help
channel.description: Guys can anyone help me with my portforwarding everytime i got on http://canyouseeme.org/ and check my port after I check uTorrent it says your port is open, but then i run my server and check http://canyouseeme.org/ it says error connection problems. please help?

item.title: Portforwarding problems please help
item.dc:creator: @ilikecheese1231 ilikecheese1231
item.description:
@ilikecheese1231 wrote:

i dont get it?? pleas team viewer me please?

Read full topic

ilikecheese1231:

urgg its useless:((((

Many of life’s failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

item.title: Portforwarding problems please help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ilikecheese1231, post:11, topic:409488”]Ok lol uhmm I got to firewall and add a 43594 as a port?

And remove a exeption on uTorrent? <-- Dont know how to?[/quote][quote=“zyle1992, post:10, topic:409488”][quote author=ilikecheese1231 link=topic=510768.msg3706534#msg3706534 date=1313080709]
Bingo:P
[/quote]

Sounds to me that you have the local firewall blocking any incoming traffic. The reason uTorrent works is because there’s probably an exception in the firewall.

Search for how to add a windows firewall port exception, and you should be set. You might need to remove the current exception for uTorrent.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding problems please help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ilikecheese1231:

Bingo:P

Sounds to me that you have the local firewall blocking any incoming traffic. The reason uTorrent works is because there’s probably an exception in the firewall.

Search for how to add a windows firewall port exception, and you should be set. You might need to remove the current exception for uTorrent.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding problems please help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ilikecheese1231, post:7, topic:409488”]If i run my server and open Error, But if i close my server and open uTorrent it doesnt say anything just this:

Background
Most residential ISP’s block ports to combat viruses and spam. The most commonly blocked ports are port 80 and port 25.

Port 80 is the default port for http traffic. With blocked port 80 you will need to run your web server on a non-standard port in conjunction with a port 80/web redirect from No-IP.com.

Port 25 is the default port for sending and receiving mail. ISPs block this port to reduce the amount of spam generated by worms on infected machines within their network. If you need to send legitimate email and your ISP blocks port 25. Consider the solutions from No-IP.com.[/quote]

That’s just the auxiliary text from canyouseeme.org saying why some common ports might be blocked.

So to clarify, if you start the RS Server and check canyouseeme.org, it says that it can’t see your computer, but if you close the server, and set the uTorrent port to 43594, it says that it can see you?

Read full topic

If i run my server and open Error, But if i close my server and open uTorrent it doesnt say anything just this:

Most residential ISP’s block ports to combat viruses and spam. The most commonly blocked ports are port 80 and port 25.

Port 80 is the default port for http traffic. With blocked port 80 you will need to run your web server on a non-standard port in conjunction with a port 80/web redirect from No-IP.com.

Port 25 is the default port for sending and receiving mail. ISPs block this port to reduce the amount of spam generated by worms on infected machines within their network. If you need to send legitimate email and your ISP blocks port 25. Consider the solutions from No-IP.com.

if i remove it then what port do i put it instead?[/quote]
